If the point of this statement was about Njegos' religion, it should say "Eastern Orthodox," or "Christian Orthodox." There is no such religion as "Serbian Orthodox." This can also be viewed as a weak attempt to nationally relabel Njegos and as such should be removed. Let's try to keep politics and ultra-nationalism out of this article, shall we? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/132.77.4.129|132.77.4.129]] ([[User talk:132.77.4.129|talk]]) 14:04, 23 October 2012 (UTC) Serbian Orthodox does exist, as does Russian, Greek, Albanian, Bulgarian and so on.
